radiographic_examinations.findings: The QT interval is 400 msec and the corrected QT interval is 448 msec, with a clear notch in the T wave. Ventricular extrasystoles are observed, originating from the end of the T wave.
radiographic_examinations.changes_over_time: On day 6 of hospitalization, the QT interval is 540 msec, and the corrected QT interval is 493 msec, with giant inverted T waves in the precordial leads.

radiographic_examinations.findings: Post-defibrillation, the patient shows deep T-wave inversion.
radiographic_examinations.changes_over_time: Intravenous lidocaine was administered, and during the following days, there were no arrhythmias recorded.
